Events.text: Roman Empire general Tiberius defeats the Dalmatae on the river Bathinus.
Events.html: Roman Empire general Tiberius defeats the Dalmatae on the river Bathinus.

Events.text: Emperor Titus ends the siege of Jerusalem after destroying Herod's Temple.
Events.html: Emperor Titus ends the siege of Jerusalem after destroying Herod's Temple.

Events.text: Deposed Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople Nestorius, considered the originator of Nestorianism, is exiled by Roman Emperor Theodosius II to a monastery in Egypt.
Events.html: Deposed Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople Nestorius, considered the originator of Nestorianism, is exiled by Roman Emperor Theodosius II to a monastery in Egypt.

Events.text: Battle of Saucourt-en-Vimeu: Louis III of France defeats the Vikings, an event celebrated in the poem Ludwigslied.
Events.html: Battle of Saucourt-en-Vimeu: Louis III of France defeats the Vikings, an event celebrated in the poem Ludwigslied.

Events.text: Olaf II of Norway is canonized as Saint Olaf by Grimketel, the English Bishop of Selsey.
Events.html: Olaf II of Norway is canonized as Saint Olaf by Grimketel, the English Bishop of Selsey.

Events.text: The Siege of Algeciras commences during the Spanish Reconquista.
Events.html: The Siege of Algeciras commences during the Spanish Reconquista.

Events.text: Christopher Columbus sets sail from Palos de la Frontera, Spain.
Events.html: Christopher Columbus sets sail from Palos de la Frontera, Spain.

Events.text: The first known letter from North America is sent by John Rut while at St. John's, Newfoundland.
Events.html: The first known letter from North America is sent by John Rut while at St. John's, Newfoundland.

Events.text: Long War: Austria captures Transylvania in the Battle of Goroszló.
Events.html: Long War: Austria captures Transylvania in the Battle of Goroszló.

Events.text: Thirty Years' War: The Second Battle of Nördlingen sees French forces defeating those of the Holy Roman Empire.
Events.html: Thirty Years' War: The Second Battle of Nördlingen sees French forces defeating those of the Holy Roman Empire.

Events.text: Robert LaSalle builds the Le Griffon, the first known ship built on the Great Lakes.
Events.html: Robert LaSalle builds the Le Griffon, the first known ship built on the Great Lakes.

links.title: René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle

Events.text: The theatre La Scala is inaugurated.
Events.html: The theatre La Scala is inaugurated.

Events.text: Treaty of Greenville is signed.
Events.html: Treaty of Greenville is signed.

Events.text: First ascent of Jungfrau, third highest summit in the Bernese Alps by brothers Johann Rudolf and Hieronymus Meyer.
Events.html: First ascent of Jungfrau, third highest summit in the Bernese Alps by brothers Johann Rudolf and Hieronymus Meyer.

Events.text: Harvard University wins the first Boat Race between Yale University and Harvard. The race is also the first American intercollegiate athletic event
Events.html: Harvard University wins the first Boat Race between Yale University and Harvard. The race is also the first American intercollegiate athletic event

Events.text: The American Dental Association is founded in Niagara Falls, New York.
Events.html: The American Dental Association is founded in Niagara Falls, New York.

Events.text: The Second Maori War begins in New Zealand.
Events.html: The Second Maori War begins in New Zealand.

Events.text: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company is founded.
Events.html: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company is founded.

Events.text: Macedonian rebels in Kruševo proclaim the Kruševo Republic, which exists only for ten days before Ottoman Turks lay waste to the town.
Events.html: Macedonian rebels in Kruševo proclaim the Kruševo Republic, which exists only for ten days before Ottoman Turks lay waste to the town.

Events.text: Judge Kenesaw Mountain Landis fines Standard Oil of Indiana a record $29.4 million for illegal rebating to freight carriers; the conviction and fine are later reversed on appeal.
Events.html: Judge Kenesaw Mountain Landis fines Standard Oil of Indiana a record $29.4 million for illegal rebating to freight carriers; the conviction and fine are later reversed on appeal.

Events.text: A major labor dispute, known as the Wheatland hop riot, starts in Wheatland, California.
Events.html: A major labor dispute, known as the Wheatland hop riot, starts in Wheatland, California.

Events.text: World War I: Germany declares war against France, while Romania declares its neutrality.
Events.html: World War I: Germany declares war against France, while Romania declares its neutrality.

Events.text: Major League Baseball Commissioner Kenesaw Mountain Landis confirms the ban of the eight Chicago Black Sox, the day after they were acquitted by a Chicago court.
Events.html: Major League Baseball Commissioner Kenesaw Mountain Landis confirms the ban of the eight Chicago Black Sox, the day after they were acquitted by a Chicago court.

Events.text: Jiddu Krishnamurti, tagged as the messianic "World Teacher", shocks the Theosophy movement by dissolving the Order of the Star, the organisation built to support him.
Events.html: Jiddu Krishnamurti, tagged as the messianic "World Teacher", shocks the Theosophy movement by dissolving the Order of the Star, the organisation built to support him.

links.title: Order of the Star in the East

Events.text: Jesse Owens wins the 100 metre dash, defeating Ralph Metcalfe, at the Berlin Olympics.
Events.html: Jesse Owens wins the 100 metre dash, defeating Ralph Metcalfe, at the Berlin Olympics.

Events.text: A fire wipes out Kursha-2 in the Meshchera Lowlands, Ryazan Oblast, Russia, killing 1,200 and leaving only 20 survivors.
Events.html: 1936 – A fire wipes out Kursha-2 in the Meshchera Lowlands, Ryazan Oblast, Russia, killing 1,200 and leaving only 20 survivors.

Events.text: World War II: Italian forces begin the invasion of British Somaliland.
Events.html: World War II: Italian forces begin the invasion of British Somaliland.

Events.text: Santa Claus Land, the world's first themed amusement park, opens in Santa Claus, Indiana, United States.
Events.html: Santa Claus Land, the world's first themed amusement park, opens in Santa Claus, Indiana, United States.

Events.text: Whittaker Chambers accuses Alger Hiss of being a communist and a spy for the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Whittaker Chambers accuses Alger Hiss of being a communist and a spy for the Soviet Union.

Events.text: The Basketball Association of America and the National Basketball League finalize the merger, that would create the National Basketball Association
Events.html: The Basketball Association of America and the National Basketball League finalize the merger, that would create the National Basketball Association

Events.text: The nuclear submarine USS Nautilus travels beneath the Arctic ice cap.
Events.html: The nuclear submarine USS Nautilus travels beneath the Arctic ice cap.

Events.text: Portugal's state police force PIDE fires upon striking workers in Bissau, Portuguese Guinea, killing over 50 people.
Events.html: Portugal's state police force PIDE fires upon striking workers in Bissau, Portuguese Guinea, killing over 50 people.

Events.text: Niger gains independence from France.
Events.html: Niger gains independence from France.

Events.text: The United States Senate ratifies the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty.
Events.html: The United States Senate ratifies the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty.

Events.text: A privately chartered Boeing 707 strikes a mountain peak and crashes near Agadir, Morocco, killing 188.
Events.html: A privately chartered Boeing 707 strikes a mountain peak and crashes near Agadir, Morocco, killing 188.

Events.text: Tandy Corporation announces the TRS-80, one of the world's first mass-produced personal computers.
Events.html: Tandy Corporation announces the TRS-80, one of the world's first mass-produced personal computers.

Events.text: Senegalese opposition parties, under the leadership of Mamadou Dia, launch the Antiimperialist Action Front – Suxxali Reew Mi.
Events.html: Senegalese opposition parties, under the leadership of Mamadou Dia, launch the Antiimperialist Action Front – Suxxali Reew Mi.

links.title: Antiimperialist Action Front – Suxxali Reew Mi

Events.text: Oued El-Had and Mezouara massacre in Algeria: A total of 116 villagers killed, 40 in Oued El-Had and 76 in Mezouara.
Events.html: Oued El-Had and Mezouara massacre in Algeria: A total of 116 villagers killed, 40 in Oued El-Had and 76 in Mezouara.

Events.text: The pedestal of the Statue of Liberty reopens after being closed since the September 11 attacks.
Events.html: The pedestal of the Statue of Liberty reopens after being closed since the September 11 attacks.

Events.text: President of Mauritania Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya is overthrown in a military coup while attending the funeral of King Fahd in Saudi Arabia.
Events.html: President of Mauritania Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya is overthrown in a military coup while attending the funeral of King Fahd in Saudi Arabia.

links.title: List of heads of state of Mauritania

Events.text: Former Deputy Director of the Chilean secret police Raúl Iturriaga is captured after having been on the run following a conviction for kidnapping.
Events.html: Former Deputy Director of the Chilean secret police Raúl Iturriaga is captured after having been on the run following a conviction for kidnapping.

Events.text: Widespread rioting erupts in Karachi, Pakistan, after the assassination of a local politician, leaving at least 85 dead and at least 17 billion Pakistani rupees (US$200 million) in damage.
Events.html: Widespread rioting erupts in Karachi, Pakistan, after the assassination of a local politician, leaving at least 85 dead and at least 17 billion Pakistani rupees (US$200 million) in damage.

Events.text: A 6.1 magnitude earthquake kills at least 617 people and injures more than 2,400 in Yunnan, China.
Events.html: A 6.1 magnitude earthquake kills at least 617 people and injures more than 2,400 in Yunnan, China.
